resources.string: Only a single anonymous user action is reported for the visit
Only performance data is captured. No data will be collected to track the user
All data is collected including information to track the user across multiple visits

string-array.name: supported_web_request_frameworks
string-array.item: Apache HttpClient: Only the Android-internal HttpClient version

resources.string: User Privacy and Data Collection Levels
Create a Custom Action and Leave when complete
Add Web Requests and Children Actions
Send Web Request(s) with a delay
Enter a name for the user action

string-array.name: data_collection
string-array.item: OFF - Only a single user action will be reported for the application starting as an anonymous user until data collection is enabled
PERFORMANCE - Performance data for the application is captured, but no data will be used to uniquely identify the user
USER_BEHAVIOR - The user will be tracked across multiple visits and can be tagged and have other SDK reported values and events associated with the session

string-array.name: user_opt_in
string-array.item: userOptIn true - DataCollectionLevel is set to OFF until adjusted with the SDK
userOptIn false - DataCollectionLevel is set to USER_BEHAVIOR

string-array.name: automatic_instrumentation
string-array.item: Lifecycle events are automatically recorded and timed
The Agent automatically records unhandled exceptions that result in application crashes and immediately sends the crash report back to Dynatrace

string-array.name: manual_instrumentation
string-array.item: Users must be manually tagged with the identifyUser method. See MainActivity.onTagSession for an example

string-array.name: standalone_instrumentation
string-array.item: Absolutely no automatic instrumentation, app must be manually instrumented
The Mobile OneAgent must be manually started

string-array.name: sending_intervals
string-array.item: The Mobile Agent reports data back to the configured BeaconURL every 2 minutes

Data is stored for up to 10 minutes. If the Agent loses internet connection or the BeaconURL becomes unavailable, it will attempt to re-send the data for up to 10 minutes at which point the data is discarded

string-array.name: purepath_requirements
string-array.item: Web request must be associated with a User Action
Back-end Webserver process must be instrumented with a OneAgent
Request is tagged with the "x-dynatrace" header

string-array.name: no_data
string-array.item: Check the logs for any errors or exceptions when the agent sends data to the beaconUrl
Ensure the OneAgent is actually running and logs are seen
Ensure that the Application in the UI is capturing appropriate % of sessions with traffic control

string-array.name: single_action
string-array.item: If sessions are appearing with only 1 user action each, this usually indicates "userOptIn true" was set but the dataCollectionLevel was never adjusted
Run a test with userOptIn false
If userOptIn is true, ensure you are calling Dynatrace.applyUserPrivacyOptions

string-array.name: missing_requests
string-array.item: The most common reason for missing web requests is that the request is made after the user action has been closed, you can increase the timeout of user actions by setting "userActions.timeout x" where x can be between 100-5000 (for ms)
Ensure that the request is made with a supported framework and does not show up in another user action

string-array.name: enable_logs
string-array.item: 1. Set "debug.agentLogging true" in build.gradle configurations for Dynatrace
1.2 If manually starting the Agent, add ".withDebugLogging(true)" to startup call
2. Reproduce the issue in a session
3. Filter in logcat for "dtxAgent" to retrieve Dynatrace logs

string-array.name: analyze_logs
string-array.item: Look for "POST url" and "Response code: 200" to ensure data is getting sent to Dynatrace and returning a 200 response
Use the "vi=<VisitorId>" to find the corresponding user in the UI, search in USQL using the "User Tag" field and put the VisitorId value in quotes when searching

string-array.name: crashes_or_unexpected_behavior
string-array.item: What conditions cause the issue? Identify any patterns and gather logs to create a support ticket
Try disabling instrumentation of sensors depending on issue

string-array.name: build_logs
string-array.item: gradlew assemble<Variant> -d -s > output_file.log 2>&1 \n\nEx: gradlew assembleDebug -d -s > output_file.log 2>&1
If build errors do not identify the issue, create a support ticket with logs and config
